actions.text: Reported to Senate from the Committee on Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs, (without written report).

actions.committee: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 94-655.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A resolution reported authorizing additional expenditures by the Committee on Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 94-655) Authorizes expenditures of $860,000 by the Senate Committee on Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs for inquiries and investigation from March 1, 1976 through February 28, 1977. Allocates $464,000 for studies of specified areas including: (1) banking and currency generally; (2) financial aid to commerce and industry; (3) deposit insurance; (4) the Federal Reserve System; (5) economic stabilization; (6) valuation and revaluation of the dollar; (7) prices of commodities, rents, and services; (8)securities and exchange regulations; (9) credit problems of small business; and (10) international finance through agencies within legislative jurisdiction of the committee. Directs that not to exceed $242,300 shall be available for investigation of housing and urban affairs. Allows the expenditure of an amount of $153,700 for an investigation pertaining to the securities industry. Requires the committee to report its findings and recommendations for legislation to the Senate no later than February 28, 1977. Directs that funds authorized by this Act shall be provided from the contingent fund of the Senate.

titles.title: A resolution reported authorizing additional expenditures by the Committee on Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs.
